bug.short_desc: Changes to line delimiter preference causes mixed delimiters in files

long_desc.thetext:
Platform: Eclipse 3.2.1 and WTP 1.5.2
The editor line delimiter preference in WTP is read when a file is opened, but only affects new lines added to the file, not existing content. As a result it's possible for a single file to have multiple styles of line endings.
Steps to reproduce: 1) Set the line delimiter preference to 'Windows' line endings 2) Create a new file with one of the SSE editors and add several lines of text. Which editor doesn't matter since the issue is in sse.core 3) Save and close the file 4) Set the line delimiter preference to 'Mac' line endings 5) Reopen the file from step 2 and add several more lines of text and save it. 6) Note that only the new lines have the Mac-style delimiters and the original lines still have Windows-style.
This is certainly not what what anyone would expect since a delimiter preference should always apply to the entire file.

Created an attachment (id=55095) PatchFor166901.txt
This patch fixes the bug reported here by translating all line endings in a file to the type selected in the preferences when the file is opened for edit.

Actually, the mixed delimiters was intentional. Though the preference says "Creating or saving files, the following line delimiter will apply" the "saving" part should be taken out because the preference was meant only for when creating new files. This is how the base text editor works as well.
If the user wants to convert line delimiters, they can use the File->Convert Line Delimiters To action.
There is a bug open on the base, bug 123287 to address the issue of providing a way to convert line delimiters on save.

bug.short_desc: Refactoring inner class causes bad JSP code and error in log

long_desc.thetext:
Platform: Eclipse 3.2.1 and WTP 1.5.2 To reproduce: 1) Create a web project 2) Add the following code as a JSP page called MyJSP.jsp: <%@ page language="java" pageEncoding="ISO-8859-1"%> <%@ taglib uri="http://jakarta.apache.org/struts/tags-bean" prefix="bean" %> <%@ taglib uri="http://jakarta.apache.org/struts/tags-html" prefix="html" %> <%@ taglib uri="http://jakarta.apache.org/struts/tags-logic" prefix="logic" %> <%@ taglib uri="http://jakarta.apache.org/struts/tags-tiles" prefix="tiles" %> <%@ taglib uri="http://jakarta.apache.org/struts/tags-template" prefix="template" %> <%@ taglib uri="http://jakarta.apache.org/struts/tags-nested" prefix="nested" %> MyJsp.jsp <% Collection foobars = new ArrayList(); %>
Login:
Password:
3) Note: The JSP page won't compile since the Struts libraries are not present, but that is not germane to the bug 4) Add the following code as a Java class called MyTest.java: package com.yourcompany.struts; /** * File MyTest.java *

Copyright (c) 2006-, MessageOne, Inc.

*/ /** * Class MyTest. * * @author rtulloh */ public class MyTest { public enum Foo { A, B, C }; } 5) Refactor the name of the MyTest.Foo enumeration in MyTest.java to MyTest.FooBar (select Foo in the MyTest class and rename it to FooBar). 6) Confirm that the Java file and JSP are listed in the refactor preview, hit Finish. 7) Notice that the JSP page now has invalid code (no trailing %> for scriptlet) in it and it even replaced the MyTest.Foo generics with just FooBar and then adds an extra ".Foo" on the second line.

bug.short_desc: CSS Formatter invalidates certain constructs

long_desc.thetext:
Created an attachment (id=55101) PatchFor166909.txt
Patch that fixes all formatting problems in this PR by adjusting StyleRuleFormatter.
I'll take a look at this one.

Amy,
>> #demo { >> background: #d5e1ed url(mixedcase/projectlogo.gif) no-repeat center >> 1.4em; >> } #ERROR - mixedCase/projectLogo.gif treated like an attribute, not a literal
>I don't understand this error. What should it look like?
The issue is that mixedCase/projectLogo.gif was changed to all lower case by the formatter. As the #ERROR comment says, it's being treated like an attribute (with case changing) rathern than a literal (where the case should remain mixed).
Hope that helps.
Ah got it. I'm assuming you mean this happens when you perform "Cleanup Document.." and set "Property value case" to be "Lower" Regular formatting shouldn't be changing the case of anything.
*** Bug 146198 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Created an attachment (id=57820) org.eclipse.wst.css.core+tests.patch
Thanks for the patch; however, it looks like the fix should actually be made in a different formatting class (DefaultCSSSourceFormatter). Attached is the final fix I'll be using.

The attached patch includes fixes to: Bug 166909 - CSS Formatter invalidates certain constructs Bug 110539 - formatting breaks rules with multiple classes for elements Bug 93037 - properties view adds extra ; when add new property
It also includes unit tests for: Bug 166909 - CSS Formatter invalidates certain constructs Bug 110539 - formatting breaks rules with multiple classes for elements Bug 111569 - Cleanup Document for CSS file inserts extra semicolon Bug 146198 - Attribute specifiers are being broken by the CSS formatter
The specific fixes for this bug include: -space added before all attribute selectors In Default CSSSourceFormatter#appendSpaceBetween() before appending space, added a check so that if (nextType == CSSRegionContexts.CSS_SELECTOR_ATTRIBUTE_START) do not append space
-url value being treated like attribute and changing its case In AbstractCSSSourceFormatter#decoratedPropValueRegion & decoratedRegion, there is already a check so that if current region == CSSRegionContexts.CSS_URI, handle url specially. Fix is to also handle CSSRegionContexts.CSS_DECLARATION_VALUE_URI regions the same way.
Fix released to WTP 2.0 M5.

Amy,
Are you currently planning to backport this fix to the 1.5.3 maintenance branch?

No, WTP 1.5.3 is in PMC review & approval mode now, so in order to make any changes to WTP 1.5.3, we'd have to bring the bug up to the PMC boad and get their permission to check the fix into WTP 1.5.3. http://wiki.eclipse.org/index.php/WTP_PMC_Defect_Review
If you'd like, I get this defect started on that process. My only concern is that this bug may not be seriously bad enough to be fixed at this point. (I believe the other bugs that have been brought to the PMC review board have been blockers)

Amy,
No problem. I agree that's it's not big enough to go get the PMC approval on this late in the cycle. It was more a "curiosity" question since our next 5.5 milestone will be 1.5.3-based and I just needed to know if we'd need to reapply our patch. Seems we will, but that's not a big deal.
Thanks, Todd

bug.short_desc: Error with DateTimeSpan.addDate

long_desc.thetext:
Hello everyone, when I use DateTimeSpan for addDate. I found the example from http://help.eclipse.org/help31/index.jsp?topic=/org.eclipse.birt.doc/birt/birt-22-2.html but when I run this script with Dynamic Text birt show this error
The following items have errors:
TextData (id = 1361): + There are errors evaluating script " var startDate = date.parse( "2004-12-31" ); var endDate; endDate = DateTimeSpan( startDate, 1, 0, 0 ); // returns 2005-12-31 endDate = DateTimeSpan( startDate, 0, 1, 0 ); // returns 2005-1-31 endDate = DateTimeSpan( startDate, 0, 0, 1 ); // returns 2005-1-1 endDate = DateTimeSpan( startDate, 1, 1, 1 ); // returns 2005-3-4 distplayString = endDate; ".
what I am wrong or this example is not correct. I want to subtract date from my parameter and show only month name, how can I do. Help me please.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 166913 ***

bug.short_desc: Error with DateTimeSpan.addDate

long_desc.thetext:
Hello everyone, when I use DateTimeSpan for addDate. I found the example from http://help.eclipse.org/help31/index.jsp?topic=/org.eclipse.birt.doc/birt/birt-22-2.html but when I run this script with Dynamic Text birt show this error
The following items have errors:
TextData (id = 1361): + There are errors evaluating script " var startDate = date.parse( "2004-12-31" ); var endDate; endDate = DateTimeSpan( startDate, 1, 0, 0 ); // returns 2005-12-31 endDate = DateTimeSpan( startDate, 0, 1, 0 ); // returns 2005-1-31 endDate = DateTimeSpan( startDate, 0, 0, 1 ); // returns 2005-1-1 endDate = DateTimeSpan( startDate, 1, 1, 1 ); // returns 2005-3-4 distplayString = endDate; ".
what I am wrong or this example is not correct. I want to subtract date from my parameter and show only month name, how can I do. Help me please.
*** Bug 166912 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Ok, I'm sorry for the duplicate bug and can everyone help me for this ploblem, please... Thanks, Sudhlo

Hi Sudhlo, I think there is something wrong int the document. Here is an example which can correctly run: endDate = DateTimeSpan.addDate( java.sql.Date.valueOf( "2004-12-31" ), 1, 0, 0 ); // returns 2005-12-31
Thanks.

There are several mistakes in the following sample code in http://help.eclipse.org/help31/index.jsp?topic=/org.eclipse.birt.doc/birt/birt-22-2.html : var startDate = date.parse( "2004-12-31" ); var endDate; endDate = DateTimeSpan( startDate, 1, 0, 0 ); // returns 2005-12-31
1. date.parse( "2004-12-31" ) should be Date.parse( "2004-12-31" ) 2. DateTimeSpan( startDate, 1, 0, 0 ) sees like a constructor. Here should be DateTimeSpan.addDate( ) function. 3. The first parameter of addDate() function shoule be a Date object, not here startDate. Because the Date.parse() will return a long value.
Thanks you for your answers Wei Zhao. I corrected this error by set the varible to date format and now it Ok, Thanks angian ^_^

bug.short_desc: [filters] Add "Hide Deprecated Fields and Methods" to Outline view

long_desc.thetext: It would be useful for the Outline view to support a "Hide Deprecated Fields and Methods" tool. Just as hiding fields, statics and local types is useful, so would the ability to hide deprecated fields and members.
If we do this it should be added to our org.eclipse.jdt.ui.actions.MemberFilterActionGroup
We wouldn't want to add an additional toolbar button, bu could add it as a filter. Would that be good enough?

Ideally a new toolbar button should be added, but I would imagine that your concern is clutter and available space. While I understand your concerns, adding this behavior to JUST the filter dialog would be inconsistent with the to other 4 "hide" tools. Possibilities:
- Flattern all the "hide" tools into a single dedicated pulldown menu of checkboxes.
- As above, but presented as a group or submenu in the view's "triangle" pulldown menu.
- Include all "hide" tools in the "Java Elements Filter" dialog. It is not unreasonable to only present a subset of the filters on the toolbar.
Keeping all "hide" tools together in a single pulldown feels right, although I am sure others will complain. But this is consistent with other Eclipse tools. Also, it makes total sense to add the "hide" tools to the filter dialog since they really are filters too.

The filter menus already contain other 'hide' tools so there's no inconsistency here: The toolbar just contains the ones we think are the most valuable. Yes, there is some potential to improve the filter-toolbar story: bringing them together and even make the toolbar customizable by the user. Howver, such an effort is not on the plan.

The inconsistency to which I was referring was the fact that the "Java Element Filter" dialog, as of Eclipse 3.2, only contains checkboxes for:
- Import declarations - Package declarations - Synthetic members
I would have expected to also see checkboxes for each of the tools, specifically:
- Fields - Static fields and methods - Non-public members - Local types
For this bug report, it would suffice to add "Deprecated members" to the list.

bug.short_desc: [build.eclipse.org] server has its DOCUMENT_ROOT == www.eclipse.org

long_desc.thetext:
$_SERVER["DOCUMENT_ROOT"] is set to /home/data/httpd/www.eclipse.org/html, while $_SERVER["SERVER_NAME"] is set to build.eclipse.org.
This has both benefits and detriments, so rather than actually complaining I just wanted to bring this to your attention. Is this the behaviour you intended?
(+) can share Phoenix resources in www.eclipse.org filesystem (-) testing new pages (which use DOCUMENT_ROOT to refer to other include files) often requires committing files to www.eclipse.org cvs and also extracting to local filesystem, since DOCUMENT_ROOT does not refer to local files in /shared/modeling/public_html. Not a showstopper.
http://build.eclipse.org/modeling/phpinfo.php
Thoughts?

It points to www.eclipse.org because I don't have a better place to put it yet. Typically I should create a new website for build.eclipse.org, put Phoenix on it, with a nice index page to what the purpose of the site is. Right now I don't have that, but it should be done.

Fair enough. Downgrading to enhancement.
Feel free to close this as WONTFIX since IMHO, this server doesn't really *need* a homepage; everyone who'd be using it will know where to go, eg., /modeling/build/, and would never need to access the web root.
Well, I put a rewrite to redirect homepage requests (http://build.eclipse.org/) to www.eclipse.org so there's no conusion. I'll close this as "sortafixed".

bug.short_desc: [api] address internal API usage of change set management

long_desc.thetext:
Our SDK-specific use of the extension point now looks like this:
<extension point="org.eclipse.mylar.team.changeSets"> <contextChangeSetManager class="org.eclipse.mylar.internal.team.ContextActiveChangeSetManager"/> <activeChangeSetProvider class="org.eclipse.mylar.internal.team.ccvs.CvsActiveChangeSetProvider"/> </extension>
Where the class bridging the ActiveChangeSet stuff (previously AbstractTeamRepositoryProvider) is now AbstractActiveChangeSetProvider. The Mylar Team plug-in uses the ContextActiveChangeSetManager (extends AbstractContextChangeSetManager).
I'll put more details in the integrators doc including the two migration steps from the previous "providers, repositories" extension points.
Done. We kept our AbstractActiveChangeSetProvider public, but will make it clear that it is not backwards compatible since it exposes internal Platform APIs.

bug.short_desc: Spinner.getSelection() returns a wrong value

long_desc.thetext:
After modifying the content of Spinner(org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Spinner), use Spinner.getSelection() to get the value of Spinner, the result is wrong. This problem occurs in linux AS4, but works well in Windows.
The code is like following: 1.Create a Spinner on a Dialog(org.eclipse.jface.dialogs.Dialog) with OK button, initialize it with the following code: newSpinner.setMinimum( 1 ); newSpinner.setMaximum( Integer.MAX_VALUE ); newSpinner.setIncrement( 1 ); newSpinner.setSelection(1);
2.in the org.eclipse.jface.dialogs.Dialog#okPressed(), I use the code newSpinner.getSelection() to get the value. Set breakpoint here.
The steps to reproduce(Use debug mode): 1. After popping up the dialog, the value of Spinner is 1, if the Spinner is not focused, use Tab key to focus it; 2. And then use keyboard to modify the value to 3; 3. Now if I click OK button, then newSpinner.getSelection() returns 3, it's right. But if I press Enter key, then newSpinner.getSelection() returns 1, it's WRONG.
Notice: between step 2 and step 3, please don't do any other operations, or you may not reproduce it.
Expected result: In step 3, whether I click OK button or press Enter key, newSpinner.getSelection() should return 3.
This problem only exists in Linux, it works well in Windows. I think it's SWT's bug. Please verify and fix it, thanks.
Which Eclipse build are you using?

Version: 3.2.0 Build id: I20060505-1306
Not only the version above has the problem, 3.3.0 also does.

fixed > 20061218
this happens because the default button of the dialogs comsumes the enter key befoer the spinner sees it.
I changed spinner to update every time the text changes.

bug.short_desc: Change the copy of data item and the before data item expression will disappeared [0001]

long_desc.thetext:
Description: Change the name of the copy of data item, the before data item expression will disappeared [0001]
Build number: 2.2.0.v20061206-0710
Steps to reproduce: 1, insert a table in layout 2, insert a data item: Name: data1 Expression: 1+2 3, copy the data1 and paste it into another column of the table 4, change the copied data item with Name: data2 and not change the expression 5, click 'Ok' button, then double click the data1
Expected result: The expression of data1 is 1+2
Actual result: The expression of data1 disappeared
Error log:
It's model team to maitenance the reference.

Currently, according the column binding rule (the rule is a discussion conclusion ), if there's no data set binding on the report item, the column binding will be added to the container of the report item. So, when user edit the first data item in table, the column binding is adding to the table, but not on the data item itself.
After copy/paste, the two data items will reference the same column binding. Hence, if user changes the name of the column binding, the other one will lose its reference.
See if we could do some enhancement that when a column binding name is changed, all its clients will change their reference name automatically. (behavior like data set)
*** Bug 167890 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

We have another bug which is the same reason with this one:
https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=166158
The key point for these two bugs is, when user double click the dataitem, he thinks that he is editing the dataitem, but NOT the databinding list. But now, the UI behavior is when user double click the data item, the pop up dialog is to modify the databinding list directly. That will make user confused that he thought he is only doing sth on the data item, but actually the column binding in the binding list changed.
So, is that a correct UI behavior?
This need more corssteam discussion, so set to M5.
In our QA opinion, it is really a issue to our user, no matter what reason the bug is caused by. I hope our team will have a discussion and solve that. Whatever, thanks a lot.
Current behavior was reviewed by PM. And there's no plan to change it by now.
closed regards

bug.short_desc: Suggest changing default value of shrink from 'true' to 'false'

long_desc.thetext: Based on current implementation, If user sets height on Label, it will take no effects. The default value of shrink is true and shrink takes higher priority than height, so the height will be ingore in Engine. To resolve this issue, there are two choices: 1. change default value of shrink from 'true' to 'false'; 2. height takes higher priority than height. If we chose the second solution, shrink property is meaningless. User can not get a way to ignore height property. Suggest changing default value of shrink from 'true' to 'false'
Changed "canShrink" default value to false in ROM.

Thanks in advance, Leif

This functionality already exists in Open Type dialog since 3.1: "The content of the dialog can further be constrained to a working set. The working set can be selected from the dialog's drop down menu."

I'm not sure?! I mean the CTRL+SHIFT+T dialog. To clarify:
I have two projects A and B. I have in project B a class CLASS-B. Project A and B have no dependencies. I create a working set SET-A containing project A and switching into it. I use CTRL+SHIFT+T and type CLASS-B.
Result: I'll find CLASS-B
Desirable result: I did not find CLASS-B, because my selected scope / working set is SET-A (project A).
Hope you get what I mean, TIA, Leif
Problem is that selecting a working set in package explorer does not set it by default in Open Type dialog... Move to JDT/UI to decide if this is the expected behavior or should be fixed.

You can set a working set filter of the open type dialog, which is from then on also persisted. But as default, we think the open type dialog should show all types in the workspace.
Not to have mutiple views using a single working set, use the Window Working Set.
The last sentence should say: 'Note: To have mutiple...'

bug.short_desc: source lookup from log4j printout fail

long_desc.thetext:
source lookup (from clicking on log4j console printouts) failes in eclipse 3.2 when using brackets in log4j conversion pattern.
This extremely useful feature worked fine until upgrading to eclipse 3.2.1 Finally figured out that eclipse does not anymore handle the use of [brackets] in log4j conversion patterns.
works not: log4j.appender.stdout.layout.ConversionPattern=%d %5p [%t] (%F:%L) - %m%n
works: log4j.appender.stdout.layout.ConversionPattern=%d %5p (%t) (%F:%L) - %m%n
This is not a platform feature. Please log a bug to whoever owns log4j (I would have moved this but I am not sure where).

bug.short_desc: externally created files show up as interesting in filtered Package Explorer

long_desc.thetext:
I have the "Focus on Active Task" button enabled in Package Explorer. Files that are created by an external process show up in the Package Explorer as interesting, as soon as Eclipses auto refresh notices them.
To reproduce: - In a Unix shell, cd into a project directory - touch "something.txt" - in Eclipse that file shows up in the Package Explorer
I noticed this because it also happens by all the files that are created by the WebObjects plugin (http://objectstyle.org/confluence/display/WOL/Home). WOLips puts it build output into a directory 'build' or 'dist' in the project root. Whenever I do a clean and full build, these directories are deleted and recreated, and then they show up in the Mylar filtered Package Explorer. I then have to maualy mark all of them as "less interestiong"
I'm not sure is this is a bug of Mylar or WOLips. Maybe it's something the WOLips plugin could prevent by setting all the files to 'derived'? But I think Mylar shouldn't show files as interesting, that I as a user have never touched.

This is currently the way that Mylar works--all non-derived resources created are marked as interesting (derived resources are things like .class files generated by the Eclipse compiler). Here is the FAQ entry on how to handle this case:
http://wiki.eclipse.org/index.php/Mylar_FAQ#Using_Mylar_with_Maven_and_other_external_builders
Marking as duplicate of bug 120499, since we should consider improving on this when we redesign inducing interest on changed resources.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 120499 ***

bug.short_desc: Local task conflict with repository dialog

long_desc.thetext:
Every time I see Local task conflict with repository dialog it is taking me dozen of seconds to figure out if I should choose yes or no. This dialog really earned to be published to "daily wtf". :-)
Please make buttons named "Override local", "Keep local comments" and also add a "Cancel" button that would scipt synchronization.
Created an attachment (id=55114) infamous dialog
*** Bug 163484 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Lets try to get this dealt with once and for all for 2.0.

Fixed. The need for this dialog has been removed. Edits are now stored separately from the report copies from the server. If a task has outgoing changes and there is new incoming, the task moves into a 'conflict' state (incoming and outgoing). Opening the task reveals the new incoming but retains your outgoing changes. If this happens while the editor is open, a (simple) dialog opens informing user that there is new data and that the editor will refresh to reveal new incoming changes. Again, your local changes are retained. You dicard your changes via Mylar context menu > Mark > Clear outgoing. Name/position of this menu option may change.
The recent changes to HEAD will result in loss of offline data.

Fixed.

bug.short_desc: Task synchronization always kicked on when task editor is opened

long_desc.thetext:
I've been watching task synchronization jobs in Progress view and noticed that they are always kicked on when I open task editor with incoming changes.
I thought that task data for those tasks should be already downloaded in the background and no additional synchronization is necessary. Currently these task synchronization jobs are accumulating and create big cpu load if I quickly browsing trough the tasks that have incoming changes. As expected those jobs do not find any new changes...

This is our open policy--once you open, we need to ensure that we kick off the synch to make sure that you are always looking at the latest task. Otherwise users are guaranteed to end up with many mid-air collisions, especially if they turn off background synch, and users' expectation is that they always have fresh data when they open (from the browser). The cost of this is many synch that don't return changes.
I don't see how we can get away from this policy so marking as wontfix, but if you have a proposal than reopen and we can consider post 1.0.

But that defeat the purpose of fetching the task data in background...
Mid-air collision is easily recoverable, so, there is no really a point to kick those heavy synchronizations. Besides, new changes may arrive to the tasks while user is staying in the opened editor.
If you completely paranoid you can introduce some kind of "latency" timeout, and if task is opened within N minutes since last synch, sync job should not be kicked.

Our current model is that once the user opens the task they will be informed of if they do not have the latest data before they try to submit. No plans to change that right now, because mid-air collisions are expensive and not that easy to recover from (i.e. involve several clicks, close inspection). Resolving for later in case we ever get to such frequent synchronizations that we can change this policy.
We have perfromance problems with that background job opening that are now being addressed as part of bug 177979.

bug.short_desc: fullscreen and virtual keyboard handling for wm2003

long_desc.thetext: There should be a way to achieve "real" fullscreen for windows mobile devices. The call to SetFullScreenMode in MobileShell sets the SHFS_SHOWSIPBUTTON flag, so the button for the virtual keyboard is always visible. For devices that use "real" keyboards this is undesired.

The fullscreen for the MobileShell is implemented the way it is because we feel there's still a chance that the application would need to call up the virtual keyboard. In the case that the device already have a hard keyboard, we should use MobileDevice's setVKStatus(int) to set the VK to be VK_ALWAYS_OFF. This should prevent any part of the virtual keyboard from presenting.
I can agree with that, but then the "SetFullScreenMode" method in MobileShell should be aware of the VK flag and not set the SHFS_SHOWSIPBUTTON in all cases.

It's not clear to me whether a change to eSWT is being made or not. I think that if a real keyboard is attached or the VKB setting is "always_off", we should not be presented with the SIP icon whether we are in fullscreen mode or not. However, especially when in fullscreen mode we should not see the SIP icon under these circumstances.
Further, if we expect the developers to code applications a certain way to get good application usability, then we should explicitly state what they should do. and get it into the Best Practices doc.

I tested and found that setting the VKStatus to always off doesn't prevent the SIP button from showing up. I have added codes in setFullScreenMode so that when a real keyboard is present on the device, the SIP button will be hiding instead of showing.

bug.short_desc: Bundles are in STARTING state while not in start() method

long_desc.thetext:
I20061205-0800
- start the SDK with "eclipse.exe -data fresh -clean -consolelog -console" - type "ss" at the "osgi>" prompt and press Enter
=> Quite a few plug-ins are now in the STARTING state. But the javadoc of org.osgi.framework.Bundle#STARTING says that plug-ins are only in this state while their start() method is running.
I would expect that plug-ins are ACTIVE, RESOLVED, or INSTALLED after startup, but not STARTING. In 3.2.1, no plug-in was STARTING after startup. AFAICS, those that are now STARTING used to be RESOLVED in 3.2.1.

This is expected behavior. It is a result of implementing the upcoming OSGi R4.1 specification. The OSGi Alliance has decided to specify the lazy-start policy from Equinox. In the design process the EG decided to expand on the lazy-start policy to allow them to contribute to the OSGi service registry before their activator is run. This is part of the reason you see these bundles in the STARTING state.
For more information on the changes see the OSGi design at http://www2.osgi.org/Design/LazyStart
Hey Tom... Can I have a $1 every time a user gets confused by this? <g>
I would rather pay you $1 to join the EG in OSGi to voice your opinion ;-)
Don't forget that Equinox is on the bleeding edge of implementing the OSGi spec changes here. So until the updated OSGi spec gets published, people may be confused by the change. :-)

We should likely broadcast something about this when the spec is closer to being final (in the new year). There may well be people doing status checks that did or did not include STARTING. Depending on what they were actually trying to test, things may have worked for them. After this change, it may be a different story. I'm not arguing that this is a breaking change, just that it is a behaviour/timing change that may have an impact.

bug.short_desc: [Browser] SSL Security Panel doesn't response after shown on XULRunner1801 at SuSe Linux 10

long_desc.thetext:
Build ID: Eclipse 3.3M3
Steps To Reproduce: Env: SuSe Linux ED 10 Eclipse: 3.3M3 JRE: Sun J2SE1.5.0_06 1. Set MOZILLA_FIVE_HOME=/usr/lib/xulrunner1.8.0.1, which is default installed XULRunner by Suse disc 2. Start Eclipse 3.3 M3 3. Open view "Internet web browser" from window->show view... 4. Try to access a SSL web link which will requires a certification examinations. (We use: https://bugs.ottawa.ibm.com/show_bug.cgi?id=123154 for example) 5. A modal dialog is opened, with "Cancel" & "OK". 6. If you click either "Cancel" or "OK", no one response to you. 7. If you close that dialog. You are not able to visit that web page. 8. Expected: User should able to click "OK" to accept, or "Cancel" to deny it, and able to visit ssl page if accept it.
More information: -> It also happens on Eclipse 3.2.1, when based on XULRunner 1.8.0.1 -> If doesn't happen on Eclipse 3.2.1, when based on Mozilla 1.7.12 gtk2 build. -> If debug into, the windowcreator callbacks are invoked, and some not-implemented methods are invoked also.
GG is investigating this but doesn't have a fix yet for 3.2.x or HEAD.

It appears that there may be a binary incompatibility here. If I use a xulrunner that I compiled on RHEL4 (exact same version of xulrunner as the one shipped with SLED10) then I can make this work fairly easily by implementing Browser.ShowAsModal(). However this does not work with SLED10's xulrunner because the Browser never receives the DestroyBrowserWindow callback that is supposed to signal it to close its certification dialog.
I'm waiting on a SLED10 CD from infra so that I can install the dev packages needed to try building swt's libraries on SLED10 instead of RHEL4, to see if this helps.
Still nothing on this. It works in the xulrunner we compile but fails in the one shipped with SLED.

I'm still investigating this, but reverting the milestone since this is not fixed in this morning's 3.2.2 build. I'm reasonably sure that this has the same cause as bug 151493. I believe that xulrunner's changed linking strategy necessitates that the Browser's linking be done differently than it has for pre-xulrunner mozillas.

The fix that we have for this problem in 3.3 HEAD works for Mozilla pre-1.8 and XULRunners that we compile but does not work for SLED. The behavior in 3.2.1 and with the new code under SLED is the same.
We should do nothing for 3.2.2 since the behavior is no worse than 3.2 and we don't know why the fix works some of the time.
Our product is based on Eclipse 3.2.2 and must support SLED 10, please consider fixing this problem.

- Eclipse 3.3 M4 still has this problem. - B.Chen, it is ok if its fix in 3.3. - For SLED10, it shares mozilla-nspr, mozilla-nss components and installed /usr/lib, while the custom build xulrunner will have these .so in the /xulrunner folder. At eclipse runtime, the .so files in /usr/lib might be loaded earier, that might be a problem if they have different version. mozilla-nspr: 4.6.1-22.2 mozilla-nss: 3.11-21.2
fixed > 0227 for all xulrunners
Verified with 3.3 I20070424 build, thanks! Grant
*** Bug 182212 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

bug.short_desc: StateHelper.sortBundles does not consider fragment exports

long_desc.thetext:
The sort algorithm currently ensures that all fragments are placed after their host. This is correct, but it does not consider when a fragment exports a package. This can cause fragments to be sorted after other bundles that depend on the packages they export.
This can cause problems in PDE-Build because the fragments are not built in the correct order.

Created an attachment (id=55132) patch
Pascal, please review.
This patch ensures that a fragment bundle is sorted before other bundles that depend on the host only if the fragment exports additional packages. Pascal can you review the PDE-Builds usecases here. I do not think this will have any adverse side-effects.
Currently if the fragment adds additional constraints then these constraints are added to the host. This forces the suppliers of the constraints to be sorted before the host and the fragment. All this patch does is ensure fragments are sorted before other bundles that depend on the host if the fragment exports additional packages. Everything the fragment needs to compile should have been sorted before the host of the fragment.

The patch looks good. However note that PDE Build does not use the state helper for the computation of the dependencies. This is mostly for an historical reason since dependency computation in pde was there before.
Take a look at PDEState.getSortedBundles(). This method uses StateHelper.sortBundles method. Is this not used to determine the compilation order?
right.... my workspace was in a weird state and I did not get all the references... sigh
Fix released for 3.3 M5.

I have found a clue here (perhaps those that are also experiencing this can verify):
1. If you log in as root and execute eclipse, the problem disappears, and the file dialog works as normal.
2. For every case of attempting to open a file dialog as a non-root user, the following message appears in the /var/log/messages file: dbus: Can't send to audit system: USER_AVC avc: denied { send_msg } for msgtype=method_call interface=org.freedesktop.DBus member=Hello dest=org.freedesktop.DBus spid=8184 scontext=user_u:system_r:java_t tcontext=user_u:system_r:unconfined_t tclass=dbus : exe="/bin/dbus-daemon" (sauid=500, hostname=?, addr=?, terminal=?) This would thus appear to be some sort of SELinux probelm.
See this bug for additional details: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=217843
This problem appears to have been solved by the release of a Fedora update for selinux-policy to version 2.4.6-7.

Thanks for the the info Kim! I know your investigative work has helped others.
Closing this bug.

long_desc.thetext:
I20061205-1200
Extract constant quick assist is cool, however it should have a lower priority then extract local: 1. It happens that I hit enter without even looking at the proposals and then I'm surprised by the result. 2. I think extract local is more important/more often used.

bug.short_desc: Formatter introduced spaces instead of tabs

long_desc.thetext: Move to JDT/UI

I'm afraid I can't reproduce this. I think this must be a combination of formatter settings, for example 'Keep simple ten tstaements on one line'.
Could you export you formatter profile and attcj it here. I'd be also happy if you could attach your code example here. It is essential that you really have tabs before the first if.
Created an attachment (id=55667) Test project and formatter settings

Ok, there goes the test project. It includes an XML with the exported Formatter Profile. Since Eclipse 3.2.1 can't export the CleanUp setting, they are the following (only the checked options):
- Code Style: Use blocks in if etc. / Always Use modifier final where possible / Parameters and Locals - Member Accesses: Use declaring class as qualifier / Change all accesses through instances - Unnecessary code: Remove unused imports Remove unused local variables Remove unnecessary casts Remove unnecessary NON-NLS tags - Missing code: (nothing)
In the Preview window you will already see the replacement of most hard tabs (not all though) by chars, inside the outer if() block.

I performed additional tests. First, I loaded the project into Rational Application Developer 7.0, which is based on Eclipse 3.2.1. Guess what, the bug doesn't happen!! But it surely happens consistently in my "pure" Eclipse 3.2.1 setup. I installed RAD with its own Eclipse runtime, didn't use the option to hook on an existing Eclipse base. My RAD installation is brand new (I'm just evaluating it), so it's less polluted by plugins and updates.
Next, I installed a new minimal Eclipse setup (just Platform + JDT), created a brand new workspace, imported the project and the formatter settings (not changing any other setting), and fired the Cleanup Wizard with the listed options. The bug is there.

One last bit of information.
I run Eclipse on top of Sun JDK. Right now I'm using 6.0 (final release), before I was on 6.0 betas and before that, 5.0. (I noticed this bug since Eclipse 3.2.0 milestones, IIRC.) But RAD 7.0 obviously runs on top of IBM's JVM, so a VM compatibility issue is not impossible. Perhaps the bug is related to some bug that exists in Sun JDK but not in IBM's.
Created an attachment (id=56099) screenshot
What happens if you unchecked using tab only for leading indentations?
So far I got only tabs using the code formatter only. I'll try using the cleanup wizard.
Added regression test org.eclipse.jdt.core.tests.formatter.FormatterRegressionTests#test642.

(In reply to comment #7) > Simplified steps: > - create a new project and make sure its formatter settings are set to 'tab > only' > - create the following file (only uses tabs) > .... > - on 'if' invoke quick fix and choose 'change if statement to block' > - see resulting screenshot I followed your steps using I20070130-0800 and I could not reproduce. Does your file contain spaces after its creation ?
Closing as REMIND.

bug.short_desc: State should have an API returning the highest bundle id encountered

long_desc.thetext: The state API should have a method returning the highest bundle id encountered. This will greatly facilitate code operating on the state since it would not have to iterate over all the bundles available.

Created an attachment (id=56420) patch
This patch adds the method State.getHighestBundleId()
The value is calculated as bundles are added/removed from the State. If the bundle with the highest id is removed then we force the highest bundle id to be recalculated the next time the method is called. This is done be iterating over all the bundles in the state. This special case may prove to be expensive but I expect it to be a rare case.
Pascal, please review. Thanks.

Created an attachment (id=57144) patch
Updated patch with HEAD. Pascal, do you still want this for 3.3?

Created an attachment (id=57165) patch
changes to not recompute the highest bundle id when a bundle is removed.
latest patch has been released for 3.3 M5.

bug.short_desc: [Viewers] et the Selection of a StructuredSelection doesnt work if node has not appeared in the tree

long_desc.thetext: None of the sample code you've provided is generated, so I suspect the problem is with your code. Are any exceptions appearing in the log? Perhaps you can use the debugger to discover why the unexpected behavior is occurring...

The problem is not with generated code. we are not attempting to generate code at all, so i dont think this relates to a CodeGen issue.
The problem is with eclipse code, that the line
getTreeViewer().setSelection(new StructuredSelection(res), true);
works when the tree has been expanded, and shown the node at some point. if the tree was never expanded then it does not work.
If this is indeed a bug (and not a problem with the your code), then it must be in JFace...
Does your content provider implement getParent() correctly? This is needed when TreeViewer tries to find a path to the element that should be selected.

bug.short_desc: [Workbench] Migrate org.eclipse.ui.ide.workbench to IApplication

long_desc.thetext: The IPlatformRunnable interface has been deprecated with the release of the new app model in bug 109893. I will attach a patch to migrate the org.eclipse.ui.ide.workbench application to the new IApplication interface.

Created an attachment (id=55146) patch
This patch adds the new stop method to IDEApplication. The main advantage to moving to the new IApplication interface is to give an external way to shutdown the application. Currently there is no way to force an application to shutdown. This causes problems when the framework is shutdown because it leaves the application running and does not give it a chance to shutdown.
I'm not sure if the code I put in the stop() method is the best way to force the workbench to shutdown. Can someone on the UI team review this and let me know what the best practice would be here. We have updated the RCP templates to use this approach. Please let me know if there is a better way. Thanks.

See WorkbenchWindow line 597 for how we close the Workbench. I would be very reluctant to make any changes to this without a strong reason.
I'll commit the rest of the patch however.

The test suites will not run if I apply this patch. You can replicate this by loading org.eclipse.platform.ui.tests from HEAD and running the UiTestSuite configuration
Here is the exception.
!ENTRY org.eclipse.equinox.app 4 0 2006-12-07 18:59:22.184 !MESSAGE Error in invoking method. !STACK 0 junit.framework.AssertionFailedError at junit.framework.Assert.fail(Assert.java:47) at junit.framework.Assert.assertTrue(Assert.java:20) at junit.framework.Assert.assertNotNull(Assert.java:217) at junit.framework.Assert.assertNotNull(Assert.java:210) at org.eclipse.pde.internal.junit.runtime.UITestApplication.run(UITestApplication.java:41) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:64) at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:615) at org.eclipse.equinox.internal.app.EclipseAppContainer.callMethod(EclipseAppContainer.java:522) at org.eclipse.equinox.internal.app.EclipseAppHandle.run(EclipseAppHandle.java:147) at org.eclipse.core.runtime.internal.adaptor.EclipseAppLauncher.runApplication(EclipseAppLauncher.java:104) at org.eclipse.core.runtime.internal.adaptor.EclipseAppLauncher.start(EclipseAppLauncher.java:74) at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:354) at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:170) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:64) at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:615) at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.invokeFramework(Main.java:339) at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:283) at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:984) at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:959)

This is because org.eclipse.pde.internal.junit.runtime.UITestApplication needs to be migrated to an IApplication also. I will attach a patch to the org.eclipse.pde.junit.runtime project.
Tod I don't really understand comment 2. Do you have a recommended approach we should use in the IApplication.stop() method or is the patch good enough here? (it does call IWorkbench.close())

tom, I am not sure pde junit applications can migrate.
sometimes people target an RCP drop and want to run plugin junit tests. In this case, pde launches the junit apps that are in the host.
If the rcp target is 3.2 based or earlier, the pde junit apps will not run if they are upgraded to implement IApplication.

Created an attachment (id=55273) pde.junit.runtime patch
Here is a patch to UITestApplication to allow it to handle both the old IPlatformRunnable objects and IApplication objects as application types.
Wassim, can you please release this fix?

I pointed you to how we do it. You should not close the workbench yourself - the workbench plug-in stop() will handle it for you.
Could you log a bug to PDE about the PDE changes? I would like to make this dependant on it and I want to wait until they are ready before I release it.
Opened PDE bug 167163

Tod and I discussed this a bit more. It looks like the javadoc for IApplication needs to be improved. It was unclear when the stop() method would be called. This method is *only* called to force an application to exit. It is not called under normal conditions when an application exits normally.
I updated the IApplication javadoc to clear this up (hopefully).
Given that I think the patch is a reasonable way to force the ide application to exit.
I will apply Toms patch when Bug 167163 is fixed.
will this patch go into M4? Also, what, if anything, will happen if the PDE fix is in and the workbench fix is not?

No - as I am dependant on Bug 167163 I had to wait until it was in and it is too late now for M4.
Tom is there any issue with this?

It should not pose any functional issues for M4. The motivation behind migrating the IDE was to get more testing on the M4 build on the new app model (and get rid of your deprecation errors). The fix in PDE is able to handle both old IPlatformRunnables and IApplicaitons.
Patch released for build >20060109
Verified in 20070206-0010

bug.short_desc: Editor hangs when copying from large XSD

long_desc.thetext:
Build ID: M20060921-0945
Steps To Reproduce: 1. Install XSD plug-in 2.2.1v20060921-0005 (the latest available today from EMF update site http://download.eclipse.org/tools/emf/updates/site.xml ). 2. Download http://www.mip-site.org/publicsite/04-Baseline_3.0/JC3IEDM-Joint_C3_Information_Exchange_Data_Model/XML/WSOO-XSD-JC3IEDM-30-2006-05-03.zip 3. Import contained project into Eclipse. 4. In project, open jc3iedm-3.0\ws-oo\schema\JC3IEDMCodes.xsd 5. In text editor, highlight some text with your mouse and hit Ctrl-C to copy it.

Jack,
Given that Ctrl-C doesn't actually work in the Sample XML Schema editor, I doubt you are using XSD's editor. You're sure you're not using WTP's schema editor? If you are using that editor you should open your bug in the web tools project.

I'm not using the tree-view editor that shows up under the Outline tab in Eclipse; I'm using the plain text editor that opens in the main Eclipse pane. I'm sorry if I didn't make that clear.
However, the tree-view editor attempts to synchronize with the plain text editor; for example, when I'm cursoring around the plain text editor, the tree-view editor opens up relevant elements, etc. (but when the file is really large -- as is the file I point to above -- the synchronization is slow).
I don't believe the problem here lies with the plain text editor, however, but with the tree-view editor after all. This is because when I rename the file to have a .txt extension, the tree-view editor does not open, and I can use Ctrl-C to copy from the file.
If you still believe this is not relevant to XSD, please point me to the right component.

Jack,
If you right click on the .xsd file and do "open with" to open a specific editor, what editor specifically are you opening?
The editor provided directly by XSD, "Open With->Sample XML Schema Editor" is, as the name implies, a sample of how to implement an XSD editor. The Web Tools project provides a high quality editor (also based on the XSD model). So if the concerns are with the sample editor, that's fine if the problem is literally a hang of Eclipse (which doesn't seem possible to be caused by Ctrl-C since that key does nothing in the sample editor) but if it's just slowness or other quality issues then I would direct you to use the Web Tools project's very nice high quality XML Schema editor.

bug.short_desc: [jres] JRE container classpath entries not computed properly per project

long_desc.thetext:
The JREContainer caches classpath entries per VM. However, the classpath entries are now different when the JRE is referenced via an execution environment.
I saw a case where there were no access rules for a JRE referenced as an EE because its classpath entries were already computed as a raw JRE for another project.

Fixed in JREContainer. The fix is to use the cache when a container entry is bound to a specific JRE, and compute the entries dynamically when bound to an execution environment.
Added tests to ExecutionEnvironmentTests: testAccessRulesPresentOnEEProject() testAccessRulesNotPresentOnJREProject()
Please verify, Mike.
*** Bug 166987 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Is this fix available in patch form? I have the problem again and I don't seem to be able to get out of it.

replacement plug-in for org.eclipse.jdt.launching
verified

bug.short_desc: [vista] Unexpected errors while running JDT/Core tests

long_desc.thetext:
Using Windows Vista Ultimate version and Eclipse build I20061129-1340, I20061205-1200.
Create a new workpsace and check-out following projects in it: - org.eclipse.jdt.core - org.eclipse.jdt.core.tests.compiler
Run JUnit test case org.eclipse.jdt.core.tests.compiler.regression.TestAll. After a while you got several errors NPE, FileNotFoundException (Access Denied) on some tests (I'll attach an example of these failures)...
Note that if you run the failing JUnit tests case classes individually, you cannot reproduce these failures. Running whole tests again do not produce exactly same errors but similar ones...
I've run these tests using different VMs: + Sun: 1.4.2_13-b06, 1.5.0_10-b02, 1.6.0-rc-b104 + IBM: build 1.4.2, J2RE 1.4.2 IBM Windows 32 build cn142-20040828 (JIT enabled: jitc)
Unfortunately my Vista box just crashed :-( and so, I won't be able to attach failures I got with all these VMs...

Created an attachment (id=55152) Patch to reduce the number of errors
Fortunately, I saved my patches on my thinkpad... :-)
This patch retries the operation when directory/file creation/deletion failed for an unknown reason and also prints log in console when it happens. I succeeded to pass all JDT/Core tests (and so compiler ones) without any error with this patch (but it happens only once!).
I have some other patches to test variations on these changes but unfortunately I cannot get any interesting conclusions before my box was broken...

Created an attachment (id=55199) Failures while running tests
Hopefully, my Vista box magically restarts this morning and I retrieved my logs... :-)
There are 4 files in this zip each one contains failures list while running tests with different VMs. You can see that if these failures are similar, they are not exactly the same ones...

Created an attachment (id=55967) Proposed patch for 3.3
With this patch I do not get any failures while running JDT/Core tests without any change in org.eclipse.jdt.core project, but only in org.eclipse.jdt.core.tests.* ones...
To summarize: tests do not use any longer java.io.File.delete() directly but org.eclipse.jdt.core.tests.util.Util.delete(File) instead. This method _systematically_ verifies that file has been *really* deleted from file system before returns. In case not, it waits and retry to delete if the file exists while 10 seconds maximum.
Note that when this happens, debug information may be available in console if tracing has been activated on org.eclipse.jdt.core.tests plugin. Also maximum time to wait before give up while deleting may be changed from 1 second to 1 minute using the debug/delete/wait value in this plugin .options file...
Released for 3.3 M5 in HEAD stream.
Need also to be fixed in R3_2_maintenance stream
Created an attachment (id=55972) Proposed patch for 3.2.2
Released for 3.2.2 in R3_2_maintenance stream.

Sorry for offtopic, does comment 4 mean, that anybody who uses java.io.File.delete() on Vista, MUST verify & then retry delete()?
Is it caused by new bug/feature of Vista, some kind of "delayed/async" delete?

(In reply to comment #9) > Sorry for offtopic, does comment 4 mean, that anybody who uses > java.io.File.delete() on Vista, MUST verify & then retry delete()? > > Is it caused by new bug/feature of Vista, some kind of "delayed/async" delete? > I'm not a Vista specialist and cannot really answer this question, but using Process Monitor (procmon.exe) while running our tests shows that tons of DELETE PENDING appears rapidly and explains our troubles...
The measure I've done showed that most of times, the file really disappear after between 10 and 50ms. So, you'll face this problem if you try to recreate the same file before this delay expired. This test case should not be so common, but may sometime happens - as for us. Note that we currently are the only eclipse component which such problems on Vista... Note also that it may be dependent on test box, but I really had not enough to continue the investigation deeper, only wrote a workaround to be sure our test will ever pass...
I did not see any similar issue on Vista forums (but perhaps missed them...), but if you have any other information, they will be welcomed :-)
Verified for 3.2.2 using build M20070112-1200.

bug.short_desc: [Markers] Issues opening stale markers

long_desc.thetext:
To reproduce: - create a workspace with a slew of Java projects (or whatever your preferred development artifacts are) with a bunch of markers (warnings or errors) - invoke a clean build - if workspace is sufficiently large, the problems view will show the "stale" markers for a while - double click on one of the markers - the editor is brought to focus, but the line information is ignored - in the .log, I see a bunch of messages like: !ENTRY org.eclipse.core.resources 4 376 Dec 06, 2006 13:01:41.585 !MESSAGE Marker id: 1525 not found.
!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui.ide 4 4 Dec 06, 2006 13:01:41.585 !MESSAGE Error accessing marker type
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.resources 4 376 Dec 06, 2006 13:01:41.616 !MESSAGE Marker id: 1525 not found.
!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui.ide 4 4 Dec 06, 2006 13:01:41.616 !MESSAGE Error accessing marker type
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.resources 4 376 Dec 06, 2006 13:01:41.631 !MESSAGE Marker id: 1525 not found.
!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui.ide 4 4 Dec 06, 2006 13:01:41.631 !MESSAGE Error accessing marker type
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.resources 4 376 Dec 06, 2006 13:01:41.647 !MESSAGE Marker id: 1525 not found.
In addition, our product generates Java files, which then get compiled. If I have markers on these generated .java files, then I get an error dialog if I double click on the marker. Exceptions are written to the .log as above, plus the error dialog seems to have a missing translation: the title is "OpenMarker.errorTitle". The message and buttons are translated properly.
I think the problems view should handle these situations more gracefully or avoid them altogether.
We have done some work in the this area in 3.3 but we should veriofy if this is still an issue

bug.short_desc: T2- Service Flows Registry: New and Edit dialog's "Service URL" must contain a "?" to be valid

long_desc.thetext: 1. Click the "ALF Service Flows Registry" tab 2. Click either the "New Service" or "Edit" buttons 3. In the "Registered ALF Service Flow" click the "OK" button 4. Notice the error dialog stating- "ServiceURL must be of the format http://server/...serviceflowname?operation 5. The "ServiceURL" must contain a "?" char for it to be validated by the dialog

Since the operation must be specified in a seaperate bx the url should not have the "?operation" suffix. The required format should be
http://servername/... serviceflowname

You can register the service flow in following ways.
You can enter the ServiceURL in the format" http://server/...serviceflowname" in serviceURL textfield and also need to specify the valid operation and service name in the corresponding text fields.
Alternatively you can also enter in serviceURL text field in the format "http://server/...servicename?operation".avoiding the rest of the fields.This will parse the operation name and service name automatically
? is not required for validation

bug.short_desc: Structure compare editor does not expand tree automatically any more

long_desc.thetext:
I20061205-0800
Compare two revisions of a *.java file with structural changes. Structure change tree used to expand automatically. Now, all nodes are collapsed initially.
*** Bug 167458 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
It would appear that setting the auto-expand level has no effect on a refresh. I have added code to explicitly expand after the tree is refreshed.
Could it be that setInput(..) is now called before setAutoExpandLevel(..), but the calling sequence has been the other way 'round before? That would then be bug 27480.

No, it's actually because we set the input, calculate the contents in the background and then refresh when we are done. As bug 27480 says, auto-expand only works when the input is changed (which makes sense).
Verified

bug.short_desc: Unexpected access restriction on xml.jar

long_desc.thetext:
Eclipse build: I20061205-1200
java version "1.4.2" Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.4.2) Classic VM (build 1.4.2, J2RE 1.4.2 IBM Windows 32 build cn142-20050609 (JIT enabled: jitc))
I have a large self-hosting workspace that has most of Equinox+Platform as source plugins. On every startup, a full rebuild happens, and I end up with compile errors on any reference to XML APIs (javax.xml.* and org.xml.*). In the project properties, I see an access restriction has been created on xml.jar on the JRE classpath container. Looks like you are getting bound to the foundation 1.0 profile. Do you have a j9 launching plug-in in your host (i.e. running the host with a J9 launching plug-in)?

No J9 plugin, no pure J9 VM installed. I have various VMs in the list of installed JREs (IBM/Sun 1.3/1.4/1.5), but no pure J9 VMs. In the EE prefernence page, I have my IBM 1.4.2 VM checked off as the preferred runtime for foundation 1.0, J2SE 1.3, and J2SE 1.4. I tried to mimic this setup in another workspace but didn't have the same problem.

Turns out to be a dup of bug 166976. John A tested the fix to bug 166976 to verify.
This problem occurrs when one JRE is bound to more than one execution environment. The access rules computed for the first environment a JRE is bound to were incorrectly re-used on the next EE.

bug.short_desc: Show Related Elements dialog not fully accessibility-compliant

long_desc.thetext:
Build ID: 3.2.0
Steps To Reproduce: Open up Show Related Elements dialog and use JAWS screen reader to hear the information about the controls on the dialog.
Problem: "Ingoing", "Outgoing", "All" Connected and "Both" radio buttons appear to be individual controls (i.e. 1 out of 1)
Expected: Controls grouped logically must be wrapped up in a Composite for screen readers to properly read them
More information:

Created an attachment (id=55156) proposed patch
Proposed patch: wrap controls logically grouped together in a Composite. This is done for "Expansion Direction" radio buttons group and "Levels" controls group.
Verified the fix with JAWS - seemed ok.

Created an attachment (id=55433) final patch
Final patch to commit - added a comment

Created an attachment (id=55436) final patch
Final patch to commit - added a comment
Patch has been committed. Marking as fixed

bug.short_desc: [multi monitor] if Eclipse is on secondary monitor to left of primary task list tooltips show on primary

long_desc.thetext: Probably due to bad handling of negative screen coordinates.
Is this a duplicate of bug#162222?
no, tooltips, not notifications.
Sorry, misread.

Created an attachment (id=62456) Mylar Tooltips Patch
This patch checks whether the tooltip leaks into the next monitor, and if so repositions the tooltip to appear completely within the monitor being moused over.
Great job Leo. Patch applied, ip log updated.
Fixed.

bug.short_desc: Apply indexer to all projects now button should not be a checkbox

long_desc.thetext: The button in the preferences which sets the indexer to all projects is a checkbox, but does not persist anything in the preferences, it's purely an action taken when you hit apply, changing it to a regular button which performs the operation when pressed seems more intuitive.
I agree. I'll also have to create a progress monitor for the action since it may take a little time to apply the setting to all projects.

I suggest to use a mechanism that is used more often in eclipse: Use the workspace setting for all indexers and change all indexers once the apply or ok button is pressed. In the project properties the user should have a check-box to 'Enable project specific settings'. If checked the project becomes independent of the workspace setting.

True. That's how the JDT and PDE do their compile settings. I guess this is similar, although I'm not sure I appreciate that approach in the JDT/PDE either.
But it's probably the best approach. Actually, the more I think about it, it's probably a good approach for managed build as well. hmmmmm.
Doug, I'd like to work on this after M5. Is that ok for you?
Sure, that'd be great. Thanks.
Fixed as proposed in comment 2.

bug.short_desc: [Edit] Undo in regular editor leaves compare editor dirty

long_desc.thetext: I opened both a compare editor and a Java editor on a file. I made a change in the Java editor which made the compare editor dirty as well. I did an undo in the Java editor and the Java editor became clean but the compare editor stayed dirty.
Fix released to HEAD
Verified using I20070206-0010

bug.short_desc: [DataBinding] Need to always check result of collection.remove()

long_desc.thetext:
Anywhere we use a collection and call collection.remove(), we need to check that the expected object was found and removed by the collection. In this situation, we should throw an exception.
The #1 cause of hard to find data binding bugs has been an incorrect equals() or hashCode() implementation. We have spent literally days on a couple of bugs tracing through our code and through data binding when our overall algorithm was perfect and there was no bug in data binding. In both of these cases the bug turned out to be some quirk or something just wrong about our equals() or hashCode() implementation in a domain object.
If an exception was always thrown when data binding tried to remove an object and couldn't (perhaps with a message "check your equals() and hashCode() methods"), we would have failed fast rather than have a hard-to-find bug.

-1
We'd be changing the contract of List by doing this. There are use cases where the consumer doesn't care if the item was found and changing this changes assumptions that are already in place and limits the ability of hiding the implementation.
I don't necessarily have a recommendation for how to resolve this yet but I don't think changing remove() is the way to go.

Dave, could you point us to places in the current code (or one example) where we call remove and should check for the returned object?
I looked at ListBinding and it works based on indices, not elements, so it seems that you are talking about the not-yet-existing SetBinding?
Ah, so I think I misunderstood your intentions. If you're saying in bindings we need to check this that's a different story altogether. :)

I'm not sure of the current code's status, but in the ListBinding implementation we have here at TPC, there are still some places where we just call list.remove() when applying the ListDiff.
The intent of filing the bug was mostly as a "note to self", make sure we get this right in the future or we'll have people asking on the newsgroup why data binding isn't working when the problem is really their equals/hashCode implementations.

bug.short_desc: [variables] allow for default detail pane

long_desc.thetext: A detail factory should be able to specify a default detail pane to use given a set of applicable detail panes for a selection. This way a factory can override the default text pane used by default for all selections.

Created an attachment (id=55166) Fix
Adds a new method to IDetailPaneFactory
public String getDefaultDetailPane(IStructuredSelection selection);
Updated DetailPaneManager calls this method on all enabled factories when determining the default pane. DefaultDetailPane always returns null for this method so contributed factories can override it.
Darin, please review the fix.
Applied patch with some javadoc changes
Verified.

bug.short_desc: catch up with internal changes in debug platform

long_desc.thetext:
The following patch needs to be applied to the HEAD stream of the org.eclispe.cdt.debug.ui plug-in to be compatible with changes in the debug platform scheduled for 3.3M4 release (Dec 15th, 2006).
The changes are mostly a re-org of imports, and also account for a small change in the PresentationContext (which no longer refers to a workbench part, but contains an id instead).
Created an attachment (id=55158) patch
*** Bug 166992 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Thanks, Darin! I'll take this and commit it on Monday.
Patch applied. Many thanks again Darin!

bug.short_desc: [History View] Team History view should use single button drop down to navigate to previous histories

long_desc.thetext:
Bug 163119 introduced two new buttons on History view toolbar. This is consistent with other Eclipse views which are using single history drop-down (Search, Console, JUnit, Hierarchy, etc) for navigation to previous entries.
Also worth to mention that toolbar on History view is quite busy and one button will be better then two, leaving more space when view is folded with other views in the same slot.

I agree with Eugene.
Since choosing a recently used file results in a server roundtrip anyway, this will never be as fast as e.g. going back in the editor history. Always choosing from an explicit list also avoids unwanted choices if the history list is not in the state the user believes it to be.
After some thought, I think this is the right approach as well and it will be trivial to convert. The hardest part will be getting an appropriate icon.
Fix released to HEAD
Verified using I20070206-0010

bug.short_desc: [usability] Expose keybindings for Team > Apply Patch

long_desc.thetext:
Wouldn't it be great if there were key bindings for everything on the Team context menu so you didn't have to grab a mouse every time you want to apply a patch or do something from that menu?
Sure, ContextMenuKey-e-p works.
Sure, if you customize your perspective and add Project > Apply Patch to the top-level menu you can use ALT-P-cursor-down-then-enter (there's no key binding for the Apply Patch subitem under Project).
But being able to bind to something more useful would be great too.
$0.02...

Apply patch is key bindable in the latest 3.3 builds.
